cons: Support workers within Field can struggle with the salary however there is opportunity for overtime and training so opportunities to move up in the business

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Maidstone, England
pros: I find that i have a great work life balance and that i am supported by my manager. The team I work in is great and the work is varied. N0 2 days are the same. I have been developed since working here and am given the opportunity to do some great project work as part of my job. The culture is collaborative, inclusive and supportive.
cons: I can't think of any

pros: The job is enjoyable, you make a real difference to the lives of vulnerable people and get to have a lot of fun going out with people.
cons: The pay is low but there are plenty of opportunities to work overtime to boost your earnings.

pros: it is a good job

review_title: A tangled spiders web, very messy and ........
pros: Staff seem to be helpful and supportive/welcoming. Just dont ask for help everyone will shut you down.
cons:
From IT support who seem to neglect the SLAs in place .....or is it that there is no SLA in place which explains the lack of service.

Finance department being very rude, not acknowledging staff needs with assistance and mocking people and thats if your lucky enough to get a response most the time your ignored.

The domiciliary care staff and managers are helpful and attentive but I guess that goes inline with there jobs as nurture providers.

job_title: Relief Support Worker in Maidstone, England
pros:
I have worked for the company for over 2 years now, it has been a brilliant experience, the good things about Choice is that they are very flexible with your working hours, if i need advice the HR team are excellent and are always keen to help me advise me on what to do, the teams are very close and work really well together, i have worked across many services and all have been great and the people we support are amazing, my job is very rewarding and i love it !

Pro's
Pension Scheme
Friendly environment 
People care 
Driving lessons
Free guidance 
apprenticeship levy
cons: due to the sector we work in we are unable to receive a pay rise

review_title: I've worked here for over 20 years
pros: Every day is different, I'm still enjoying the job after all this time.  I keep learning and I get support to continue developing my career and helping other people.
cons: Sometimes there is too much red tape and paperwork, this might not all be coming from Choice Support, but from the regulators of social care.

review_title: Not the company it used to be sadly.
pros: Good training and lovely service users.
cons: Minimum wage and poor communication.

pros: Great team, supportive manager, good training and enjoyable work.  They really try to do their best for people.
